LOCODE |blank2_info = US XHT |footnotes = }} 'Loveland' ( ) is a city in
Hamilton, Clermont, and Warren counties in the southwestern part of the U.S.
state of Ohio. Considered part of the Greater Cincinnati area, Loveland is
located near exit 52 off Interstate 275, about northeast of the Cincinnati city
limits. It borders Symmes, Miami and Hamilton Townships and straddles the Little
Miami River. The population was 12,081 at the 2010 census and was estimated at
12,082 in 2011. Once a busy railroad town, Loveland
is now a major stop along the Little Miami Scenic Trail.
